segment.source: How to Upgrade a Virtual Application by Using the Command Line
segment.target: How to Upgrade a Virtual Application by Using the Command Line

segment.source: How to Upgrade a Virtual Application by Using the Command Line
segment.target: How to Upgrade a Virtual Application by Using the Command Line

segment.source: How to Upgrade a Virtual Application by Using the Command Line
segment.target: How to Upgrade a Virtual Application by Using the Command Line

segment.source: Use the following procedure to upgrade a virtual application by using a command line.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to upgrade a virtual application by using a command line.

segment.source: To upgrade a virtual application
segment.target: To upgrade a virtual application

segment.source: On the computer that is running the Application Virtualization (App-V) Sequencer, to open the command prompt, select Start, Run, and type cmd.
segment.target: On the computer that is running the Application Virtualization (App-V) Sequencer, to open the command prompt, select Start, Run, and type cmd.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: At the command prompt, specify the location where the App-V Sequencer is installed.
segment.target: At the command prompt, specify the location where the App-V Sequencer is installed.

segment.source: For example, at the command prompt, you could type the following: cd C:Program FilesMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.
segment.target: For example, at the command prompt, you could type the following: cd C:Program FilesMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.

segment.source: At the command prompt, type the following command, replacing the text in quotation marks with your values:
segment.target: At the command prompt, type the following command, replacing the text in quotation marks with your values:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can specify additional parameters by using the command line, depending on the complexity of the application you are upgrading.
segment.target: You can specify additional parameters by using the command line, depending on the complexity of the application you are upgrading.

segment.source: For a complete list of parameters that are available for use with the App-V Sequencer, see Sequencer Command-Line Parameters.
segment.target: For a complete list of parameters that are available for use with the App-V Sequencer, see Sequencer Command-Line Parameters.

segment.source: Use the value descriptions in the following table to help you determine the actual text you will use in the preceding command.
segment.target: Use the value descriptions in the following table to help you determine the actual text you will use in the preceding command.

segment.source: Value
segment.target: Value

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: pathtosourceSPRJ
segment.target: pathtosourceSPRJ

segment.source: Specifies the directory location of the virtual application to be upgraded.
segment.target: Specifies the directory location of the virtual application to be upgraded.

segment.source: pathtoUpgradeInstaller
segment.target: pathtoUpgradeInstaller

segment.source: Specifies the Windows Installer or a batch file that will be used to install an upgrade to the application.
segment.target: Specifies the Windows Installer or a batch file that will be used to install an upgrade to the application.

segment.source: pathtodecodefolder
segment.target: pathtodecodefolder

segment.source: Specify the directory in which to unpack the SFT file.
segment.target: Specify the directory in which to unpack the SFT file.

segment.source: pathtodestinationSPRJ
segment.target: pathtodestinationSPRJ

segment.source: Specifies the path and file name of the SPRJ file that will be created.
segment.target: Specifies the path and file name of the SPRJ file that will be created.

segment.source: Press Enter.
segment.target: Press Enter.

segment.target: Related topics
